message.body: I think it's a combination of 2 things
I love how you're 'busy'
It's always red
The first is fighting the reflexive relationship-y actions
Or maybe that is just it
I don't know
It just gets harder/more complicated while in public occasionally
So I'm policing my actions even more
Does that make sense?
eh, sorta
I mean, I think you're fine
why thanks ;)
and like I said, some people may see us and just make an assumption
you may be overthinking it a bit
but, long car rides
Isn't that essentially guaranteed?
I think this would be easier if we weren't supposed to be keeping it from people?
keeping what from people?
from whom?
and strangers I could give a fuck about
Claire
they can assume that we are together, but it's not like we act like a couple
I dunno, I feel like we have fine
k
I don't think I am totally clear on what you are saying though
I would say that you didn't seem that comfortable with me and amy together
But I was fine with you and Claire
I wasn't uncomfortable with the Amy thing.
But I definitely was acting weird about it.
Trying to think of why
because it's fucking weird?
maybe
possibly
What?
The openly staking out territory thing definitely put me off balance a little
I didn't really see it that way
maybe not
I dunno, had I not said a word about it/it not happened I think it would have been different
maybe
I think it's just Amy =/
haha, seems to be the case all around
I don't know how to verbalize it
There was just this vibe that I got
and I may have used those words verbatim with kristin yesterday
That I was being confronted somehow
or challenged
And maybe I was imagining it
I don't know
The _text_ was because I was irked about the sudden change in plans and didn't know what the fuck was going on.
well, that was kristin
Yeah, but I didn't know that
And no one explained anything to me
she makes bad decisions
like telling those guys to show up at vals
All I knew was that I wasn't going anywhere without my purse
without even asking as I recall
Which was in Kristin's car
And then you were getting into Amy's car
you never said that though
And I was like "wtf is going on"
and you were tipsy
I did say it, actually
But who knows if it was loud enough
after kristin freaked out and told amy to take us home, I got in her car
you were standing right there
but whatever, it doesnt' matter
yeah
I need to learn to not get rides from kristin
It was a bitchy text, though, and I apologize for that
I think I worded it wrong too
I don't think I was concerned with what it suggests I was irritated about
but maybe
yeah, which is why I ignored it
I didn't really know what you were talking about and I knew you were a little drunk
Im talking to amy
she's all like, "what are you doing tomorrow?"
I'm like, "ah, man..."
she said kristin txt her about doing something for my birthday
have fun with that
Amy 2 days in a row should be awesome.
are she and Kristin friends now?
They seem to be talking/hanging out more than it sounded like they would
dude, who the fuck knows
she'll be gone in a week, and it won't matter
kristin needs to figure her shit out
funny thing is, amy really likes kristin
and kristin doesn't seem to be able to stand amy for more than 20 min
hm
I told her last night that she tries to hard to be amy's friend
and if it's not there it's not there
because she keeps it bottled up inside until she explodes
yeah
it's no good
she's too concerned with what people think
she hates how amy talks shit about people
I kind of figured that would be the issue
or an issue
one of several
You said she'll be gone for 6 weeks
was she planning that while she still had ajob
or is that a post-lay off decision?
no, it was in advance
What was she doing that would allow her to take 6 weeks off?
she takes a class or something
and evidently her employer didn't like it much anyway
ah
Thinking about making bread
oh yeah?
I have a breadmaker
low-carb bread
huh?
using almond flour and flax meal
hmmm
worth a shot
Ugh, I'm exhausted.
We didn't even do anything today
Not enough to account for the level of tired I am
haha, wanna see a pic of my ex I found?
uh
I suppose?
it was taken six years ago so
http://imgur.com/Yikep
Is this the 'model hot' one?
yeah
she's 5'10"
yeah, I fucking beat man
I feel like we got a decent amount of sleep
eh, I don't think that's it
Dude
still
I don't remember anything from way back when
O.o
What
wtf
What
=P
You asked
you just said you didnt though
what
whatev
hey...
so
what's up?
lol
(awkward pause)
Uhmmmmmmmmmm.... not too much.
You?
mwh
meh
about last night...
Insofar as the discussion?
yeah
I'm a little confused
k
are you starting to have second thoughts?
Nah
or just surprised by some of your reactive behaviors
I was more just wondering if I/we were lying to ourselves about the actual _thing_ that we're doing.
Because I can be prone to that occasionally
And I don't like it when I catch myself doing so later.
do you feel like we are?
I don't know.
awww, claire wished me a happy birthday
I don't know that changing the name would effect anything anyway.
name?
I don't know <~ mantra
I suppose we all have our own definitions
i.e., you are single, see other people
a casual relationship is one where you are dating non-exclusively
so you go on dates together and such, but aren't necessarily 'friends'
hm
it's not a huge difference
but generally you arent' talking about the other people you're dating
haha
I like you as a friend, but I don't really see you as a romantic partner
right
Same
like I said, it's a total chemistry thing
The reflexive relationship urges are what keep throwing me off I think
but then I got used to it
Interesting
it's a normal reaction
I suppose
It didn't irk me at all, until the Amy thing. I don't know what the issue is there.
partially because you don't know how you're going to feel
even though I didn't tell you until the next day
I wonder if it was easy with Claire/Ally because they didn't know about our thing
So it was a competition
wasn't*
Whereas Amy and I knew about each other
it's never a competition
but it can be seen as one
I agree, I don't feel competitive about it
I told amy the same thing yesterday
about you
What do you mean?
and that she's not competing with you
Ah
I don't want to compete
she felt like she was
What
whyhowwtf
yeah, and what do you think she wants?
It's not like I live there with you guys
right, but it's not the same
It's entirely the same
no because we where all there
/shrug
That's her problem, man.
like I said, how would you feel in that situation?
OMG
hahah
Not so much
haha
More that I schedule time with you
I expect that time to be mine
Anything outside that time is immaterial or a bonus
Dude
=P
indirectly
And booze.
=P
yeah, but it's worth it
Sure.
and you didn't pay for booze this past weekend
Oh, so it only counts if I do it every time?
We have some hilarious conversations about this shit.
I think the competitive thing is what threw me off
I really was getting a weird confrontational vibe that I didn't feel like dealing with.
I don't get confrontational over men.
so then dont
it's her problem then
Yeah, but my instinct at that point is to avoid the whole situation
then avoid it
probably for the best
heck, you were in the pool half the time
Right.
Why do you think that was
you like swimming?
Whatever, I'll just have to make more friends, I guess.
what the fuck am I suppose to do?
The fuck if I know, dude
idk
what is that going to do?
Or tell Dan and date her anyway
it's not going to change anything
um, no
Enh, it won't be a problem anyway
that's a horrible suggestion
Might as well just let it go
what?
with her going away
right
It won't be a problem again, at least in the near future, so we're talking about it for nothing
I dunno, you're acting weird
The whole thing was just disconcerting for me, and I'm trying to understand/reconcile why.
well maybe we should take the week off
since you're going back home anyway
It might end up being 2 weeks
Yeah
fine...2 weeks
why not make it three?
Not sure what next week holds. I just learned that a friend from Florida is planning a road trip north, so I might be unavailable-ish.
I was just warning you, not trying to be bitchy about it
I was just trying to make it as cliche/awkward as possible
lol
this is definitely going in the script
ha.
so when do you leave?
Probably Friday
after work?'
Nah, I took the day off
ah
I used to drive up after work, but I don't really like doing long distances in the dark when I don't have to
So Friday morning most likely
shit, I love night driving
After working all day?
And getting up at 6:30-ish?
sure
Meh
I'd rather not do a 5-hour road trip while tired
true
Why do you ask? Did you want to try getting together beforehand despite the 'taking the week off' thing? haha
Um, no that wasn't why I was asking
aw
Sorry just being honest
No, it's not a big deal
I was just joking anyway
With the 'aw'
I mean, I dunno. I need a few days
Yeah, that's fine.
Are _you_ having second thoughts?
No, I just want some time. Ive wanted it before in a way, as in I thought maybe the frequency was getting to be an issue
Yeah
besides, it seems that things could continue to get complicated, with claire returning and this new chick christine in the mix
Alright.
but yeah, nothings changed as far as Im concerned
when do you return?
The 3rd I think.
Obvs have the 4th off
yeah, I might go to philly for the 4th
we have a cs'er staying here from the 3rd to the 5th
Like I said, I'm not sure what my availability is going to be like that week
We'll have to see.
who knows, I might be working
Down in Dover?
who the fuck knows
hopefully not
holy shit
you should see the text I just got from jen
Your cousin?
Err +'s wife

"OK, I see you have found a strategy that works for you. Glad that you have found a lifestyle that makes you happy, fulfilled, and content. I have long thought that you might be happier in a different sort of relationship...but that is simply an opinion based on my own experiences and preferences, not yours. Your relationships appear adolescent and stunted to the outside observer, but only you and your not-girlfriends know what goes on within them. I will officially stop being disappointed by what looks like you sabotaging yourself and appreciate that you are an adult and your ideas differ from mine. You won't hear a peep from me about it now that my texty diatribe is complete."
Wow.
yup
Seems kind of....bitchy.
yeah, it's pretty much the relationship we have
I think she secretly is fascinated by me
You would.
or is secretly fascinated? yeah I like that better
dude, I have slightly more info than you do regarding the matter
she's married, has two kids, and is fairly miserable most of the time
I was mostly just joking
I can actually kind of see that
Based on the 2 minutes of meeting her
and a lot of the 'bitchy' I pick up I feel is more resentment
It was bitchy of her to phrase things like that, regardless
It doesn't matter why you strike out, just that you did
one time, she did say something that turned out to be rather awkward
At least insofar as describing it
Did you tell her about our situation?
yes, not in detail
just that we aren't dating
I almost feel like she takes it as me rubbing it in her face, and reacts accordingly
I have unusual relationships with women
You? Unusual?
yeah, that's part of it
You thrive on unusual
I don't know if I can have a normal relationship with a woman
Normal relationship is kind of a myth anyway, isn't it?
it's weird, because I feel sometimes like everyone is trying to catch up to me
and I know that sounds bad, but whatever
It just sounds very you ;)
people honestly tell me these things to my face
I've gotten it from cable customers of mine
...what lol
that i've had very little interaction with
not those words exactly
but sometimes you just click with people, and it happens to me a lot
and some people just don't know how to react to it
because it's something that they just aren't used to
it's weird when someone calls you out on it though
like this weird hippie festival that I went to
the lady met me and was just like, "whoa"
it's weird to get a reaction like that right away, usually it takes time
I don't feel like you're 'ahead' of me
I didn't say I was, it's just how some people react to me
Probably because you're relatively charismatic and some people are easily affected by that
You're a bit braver than the average person, insofar as not following our cultural norms regarding work/life, but overall, I don't think you have that much more figured out than anyone else.
I asked my friend once, and she told me, "well, you're 'different'"
You live/associate with a whole bunch of "different" people
well, you've never asked
Never asked what?
what I have figured out
If i did ask, what would you say?
that I don't have it all figured out
but more importantly, that I don't need to, because it doesn't matter
that making 'figuring it all out' is the mistake that we make, because it's just not a possibility
^the goal
right
Maybe.
I think it's more about finding a place in the world where you're comfortable
but that's just he beginning, because we do need some insight/knowledge
hmm, disagree
Whether that's a physical place, a profession, a relationship, whatever
Well, that's my quest, I think.
see, this is what I am talking about
you're getting lost in the details, and the details don't matter
I'm not
That just seems like the journey I'm on
you're not a place, you're not a profession, you're not a relationship
And?
you aren't a mind, but most people are completely absorbed in their minds
in their ego state, the programmed mind of society
we all have it, and we can't get rid of it. all we can do is recognize it and how it influences us
Mmhmm... and?
it is formed out of necessity, out of instinct and survival
and all negative emotion comes from it
I'm waiting for you to tie it back to what I said and make an argument for why what I said is 'wrong'?
fear, jealousy, hate,
what did you say?
about comfort?
That I think it's more about finding a 'place' in life where you're comfortable, not so much about 'figuring it all out'
you'll probably never find it
your ego will follow you wherever you go, until you sort out your inner demons you can never be comfortable
that is the mistake people make, they let a place, person, or thing define who they are
You're making assumptions, a bit.
I understand what you're saying
they let society define who they are, instead of letting go of structure and definition
That's sort of the same thing that I'm saying, actually
you can 'accept' certain things, you can live in denial, I'm not saying it doesn't happen
So, look at what you said "letting go of structure and definition". It's applicable to what I said re: comfort.
yes, structure and definition = comfort to most people
Riight...
but it's wrong
the key is to be comfortable WITHOUT them
Sigh.
the world is chaotic
it's suppose to be that way
we make it organized and sane

Comfort in a physical place: not just staying somewhere because that's where your friends/family/job/expectations are.
Comfort in a profession: giving up your middle management position that society says is the goal and turning to entrepreneurship or farming or consulting.
Comfort in a relationship: break up with the person you're with if you're just staying because it's easy, or take a chance with someone who rationally/socially is a poor choice but who makes you happy.
We're saying the same thing, but in different ways.
but it's not going to work like that
you can't just make those choices right away, you have to understand why you are making those choices
it has to come from within
and less of a thought process
Do I seem like the type of person who does things without questioning/understanding why?
no
That's an integral part of any process for me, not something I need to learn how to do.
there is a fair amount of understanding that is involved
most people do react to their emotions, but they don't take it that far
they just continue to do the same things over and over
this vicious cycle of joy and sorrow
and that is really what life is
so if you get to caught up in the details, you will never get the focus that you need
Why do you need focus if you're supposed to be myopic to the details?
part of the decision making process is the acceptance that it doesnt matter
That what doesn't matter?
Life?
That there's no meaning/goal to life?
no, that your decision doesn't matter
because its going to happen regardless. Unless you are going to sit around an dwell on it the rest of your life, the decision you make doesnt really matter
just do what you feel is right, and move on
it's not about making the right or wrong decision, because you can't know the outcome until after it's made
so...it doesn't matter
Interesting
whatever decision you make is the right one, because it's the one that becomes reality. the other options disappear
ever if they re-appear, they are still gone from the present
which is all you need to be concerned about
your mind will take care of all the mundane decisions for you, the getting up and taking a shower and going to work and eating and sleeping
It's funny how we have the same approach to things a lot of the time, but it comes from completely different mindsets/approaches
mindsets/directions*
I mainly focus on interpersonal stuff, because it has a huge influence on our daily lives
and because we can't control others
so it's the area that requires the most 'understanding'
and in reality, we are part of that 'others' as well
because we cannot control how we feel, or ever how we react
your mind can tell your body not to do something, and it won't listen
I focus on inner-personal stuff =P
The hell you can't control that
I mean, not immediately
But you can, most certainly, affect your own behaviors and responses
Over time.
yes, but that's just training
and it's inherently wrong
Completely disagree with it being wrong
you instinctually know what's right
Not necessarily
you don't need to 'train' yourself to behave 'correctly'
Why not? You were trained to behave the way you currently do.
you need to free your mind of the notion of 'incorrect behavior'
It's not like we're blank pages
And all we have or feel is natural
We were socialized by our parents, friends, teachers, etc. while we were growing up
no, but ideally we would
Who the fuck cares about ideals?
but in order to exist as we do, in this society, we need some of that training, but we are 'overtrained'
I'm talking about changing the way you react to things in order to eradicate inconvenient/irritating socializations
Exactly
I call these people 'Republicans'
Whatever
would you like to know the secret?
You can't say that we're overtrained *and* that we instinctively know what's right
why not? not mutually exclusive
You can't say that we're overtrained, but that it's wrong to want to change that
It's not mutually inclusive either, if that's a thing
they come from different places
and the key is understanding/recognizing which is which
Yeah, and I think you're stretching the use of "instinct" a bit.
well I have to work withing the framework of laguange
intuition, if that makes you feel better
Most people aren't capable of the level of introspection required to differentiate instinct-instinct and instinctive-because-of-socialization
well...
isn'
t that how this whole thing started
about 'catching up
or 'being ahead'
Perhaps.
Without me feeling what those people feel, it's hard to understand what they mean, because I think it's bullshit. ^_^
that's your ego talking
How so.
how not so
because its an acknowledgement of superiority, in a sense, even though it's not
and the ego doesn't do that, therefore you're not willing to do that
Willing to do what?
You're particularly difficult to understand today.
acknowledge another as superior, or agree that someone else would
without justification that you feel is worthy
the ego perceives things much differently
it's more about the 'feeling' that people get
not what they 'think' of me

1) I acknowledge plenty of people being superior to me in certain/different aspects. You're just not one of them. I respect you and your characteristics, but I feel like we're relatively on par. 2) I can completely understand why some people would consider you superior to themselves. I just don't understand exactly how "ahead" is being used.
I am plenty egotistical though, and I have a superiority complex, and I'm not particularly ashamed of either.
the ego state I am referring to is slightly different than what I believe you are
also, 'I' do not feel I am superior to you or anyone else for that matter, but that's another story
my 'ego-self' does feel superior
'my mind' feels superior
and it doesn't surprise me that you feel that way. You have a different set of priorities than I do
I could go on forever, but I've got to run
Alright
